# Ceres

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- Discovered in 1801 
- Largest body in asteroid belt.
- Dwarf planet
- Diameter = 940 km (Moon diameter $\approx$ 3500 km)
- Quarter of mass is water/ice mantle surrounding a rocky inner core
:::
::: {.column width="45%"}
::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
![[Images captued by NASA's Dawn Spacecraft. Centered on **Occator crater**.](https://photojournal.jpl.nasa.gov/catalog/PIA21906)](figures/13/600px-PIA21906-Ceres-DwarfPlanet-HighResolution-Dawn-20170920.jpg){#fig-ceres fig-align="center"}
:::
:::

# Asteroids

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- Rocky planetesimals.
- Most in Asteroid belt  between Mars and Jupiter.
- Asteroids are rock fragments.
- Generally not large enough to be spherical.
- Erratic rotation periods.
:::
::: {.column width="45%"}
::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
![[This movie of asteroid 2014 JO25 was generated using radar data collected by NASA's 230-foot-wide (70-meter) Deep Space Network antenna.](https://photojournal.jpl.nasa.gov/catalog/PIA21597)](figures/13/PIA21597_-_New_Radar_Images_of_Asteroid_2014_JO25_(cropped).gif){#fig-2014J025-tumble fig-align="center"}
:::
:::

# How dense is the asteroid belt?

- Model the belt as a single ring of material 2AU from the Sun.
- Number of objects in the belt is $\approx$ [$1.3\times10^6$](figures/13/Asteroids-KnownNearEarthObjects-Animation-UpTo20180101.gif)
